entry.title: On the ground in Aurora today üí™ With a major wave of...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

On the ground in Aurora today üí™ With a major wave of evictions looming, PSL is hitting the streets to talk to the community about building the struggle for rent cancellation.

The patchwork of temporary eviction moratoriums is not enough to address the colossal crisis facing the people of this country. When they expire and rent comes due, millions of people will be out on the street, including hundreds of thousands in Colorado. The people need rent and mortgage cancellation now‚Äînothing less! #CanceltheRents

entry.title: PSL Denver's Joel Northam and Lillian House join PSL...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

PSL Denver's Joel Northam and Lillian House join PSL Detroit and Detroit Will Breathe to talk about the repression activists around the country are facing for standing up to the police.

Party for Socialism and Liberation - Detroit was live.

PSL and DWB Starting now!

entry.title: Joel Northam and Lillian House, local organizers facing the...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Joel Northam and Lillian House, local organizers facing the potential of decades in prison for their organizing for justice for Elijah McClain, are joining PSL Detroit and Detroit Will Breathe today at 1PM today for a forum on repression and the movement. Detroit Will Breathe has similarly faced severe police harassment and repression for organizing against police terror.

Tune in to hear from organizers from both cities who are battling this repression. Register for the webinar here:
https://us02web.zoom.us/‚Ä¶/register/WN_nDrht2iQRnuVsj_uNAxEUw

SAT, DEC 5

PSL & DWB: Repression and the Movement

Online EventCauses ¬∑ 165 people

entry.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+2Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSLIn the last few decades, tech...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+2Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

In the last few decades, tech developments‚Äìparticularly automation‚Äìhave transformed the economy in such a profound way that many are comparing this era to the I...ndustrial Revolution.

Some capitalist economists downplay the resulting loss of jobs, while others predict that such job loss is only temporary and will work itself out through the marketplace over time, similar to previous technological revolutions.

In both cases, they seem to forget the permanent unemployed produced by the Industrial Revolution, underestimate the potential impact of modern automation technology, and disregard the irrationality and anarchic nature of capitalist development. In many ways, the current ‚Äúautomation revolution‚Äù is similar to the introduction of machines in the Industrial Revolution, which radically changed capitalist societies by amplifying inequality, creating a permanent unemployed class that Marxists call the industrial reserve army, and intensified colonialism.

Today‚Äôs automation revolution will similarly transform the landscape of labor, as robotics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning make the automation of vast swaths of complex jobs possible.

The rise of automation will accelerate the growing inequality that we see today, where the three richest people in the U.S.‚ÄìBill Gates, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffett‚Äìown as much wealth as the bottom half of the country‚Äôs population. Capitalism is a hopelessly outdated system, which has only preserved itself through violence.

We have witnessed the ability of socialism to thrive under far more difficult circumstances. Cuba and the DPRK guarantee housing, healthcare, education for all, despite being small, historically underdeveloped countries saddled with crushing sanctions.

There is no such thing as a ‚Äúshortage of jobs.‚Äù There is only a shortage of jobs that can be exploited for a profit. There is plenty of work to be done, and with socialism we could fully utilize the vast potential of the working class.

See More

Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Car protest as Rosenblatt‚Äôs hearing begins, 1/21.

entry.title: 51 years ago today, young revolutionary Black Panther Fred...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

51 years ago today, young revolutionary Black Panther Fred Hampton was assassinated by Chicago police. Hampton was just 21 years old, but his life was rich in struggle.

Hampton was a community-builder. He brokered a nonaggression pact between Chicago‚Äôs most powerful street gangs, urging them to turn their anger and guns around on their oppressors, not on one another. He created the Rainbow Coalition, a class-conscious and multi-racial alliance.

On December 4th 1969, the Chica...go PD drugged Chairman Fred, stormed his apartment and executed him in his sleep, along with Panther leader Mark Clark. Fred‚Äôs wife and son somehow survived the volley of 99 bullets. It was a military style invasion and execution.

This was not an isolated instance. This was US government policy.
Hampton‚Äôs murder was part of a pattern of police raids, false imprisonment and executions of Black Panthers. COINTELPRO documents proved that assassination of Black leaders was among its aims. Fred Hampton and the Black Panther Party had to be eliminated simply because they had touched upon capitalism‚Äôs greatest weakness‚Äîthe decisiveness and strength that a multi-national movement has in a battle against this system.

The Black Panther Party arose from the struggles of the African American people, historically the most oppressed and exploited group in the United States. They symbolized hope and received the greatest affection. They attributed Black oppression to the capitalist system, and dared to pick up arms against the state. The militancy and defiance of these young revolutionaries deeply impacted the Civil Rights and socialist movements.

Hampton and the Black Panthers believed all would benefit if the banner of the struggle against racism and national oppression was taken up by the white masses as their own. Hampton knew that it was possible to smash the racial barriers created by capitalism to divide and conquer the working class. His confidence was based on the strong belief that this system provides a motive for all to unite and engage in revolutionary struggle.

Long live the memory of Fred Hampton and the Black Panther Party!

See More+3

entry.title: More disgusting maneuvers by the city of Aurora to get...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

More disgusting maneuvers by the city of Aurora to get Elijah's killers off the hook üò° ‚ÄúWhat they‚Äôre effectively able to do is use the legal process to try to wear out grieving families with limited resources, but we‚Äôre not going away," said Mari Newman, lawyer for the McClain family. "This is an example of law enforcement and medics trying to continue to avoid accountability when they killed this innocent young man. And instead of doing what‚Äôs right, they‚Äôre using every tool..., filing every possible motion to try to beat this grieving family into submission.‚Äù

üí•FIGHT BACK!üí• Along with this maneuver by the city, the cops fired for the scandal involving photos mocking Elijah's death are appealing for their jobs back beginning next week‚Äîincluding one of the cops that killed Elijah, Jason Rosenblatt.

entry.title: #BREAKING In response to protests, Governor Polis has walked...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

#BREAKING In response to protests, Governor Polis has walked back his amendment which altered the scope of the state‚Äôs investigation into Elijah McClain‚Äôs death. He has restored references to criminal offenses and prosecuting the police in the language of the order.

To be clear, this is still nothing more than a symbolic demonstration of good will. We will not settle merely for symbolic justice. We demand murder charges for Jason Rosenblatt, Nathan Woodyard, and Randy Roedema‚Äînothing less. Our eyes are still on Polis and AG Weiser.

Salute to everyone who has been part of this movement demanding justice for Elijah McClain. This charade proves we MUST maintain vigilance and continue to fight every step of the way. The struggle continues!

Gov. Jared Polis made a second revision Wednesday to his executive order directing Attorney General Phil Weiser to investigate the death of Elijah McClain, acknowledging previous tweaks to the orde‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

Polis revises Elijah McClain executive order to restore reference to potentially prosecuting police

Gov. Jared Polis made a second revision Wednesday to his executive order directing Attorney General Phil Weiser to investigate the death of Elijah McClain, acknowledging previous tweaks to the orde‚Ä¶Gov. entry.title: Denver City is sweeping 300 people who are house less from an...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver was live.

Denver City is sweeping 300 people who are house less from an encampment where some have resided for several years. This camp is the last refuge for people who have been swept all summer. Meanwhile there are enough vacant apartments and houses in Denver to house the entire 6,000+ house less population three times over. Instead of providing houses to these people, the only true solution to this crisis, the mayor would rather send police in to forcibly move people who have no where to go.

1.2K Views

entry.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverZinn Education ProjectOn Nov. 29, 1864, a Colorado Calvary unit, acting on orders from Colorado's...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverZinn Education Project

On Nov. 29, 1864, a Colorado Calvary unit, acting on orders from Colorado's Governor and ignoring a white surrender flag flying just below a U.S. flag, brutally... attacked Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes including Chief Black Kettle (in photo), in what became known as the Sand Creek massacre. Captain Silas Soule (in photo), raised in an abolitionist family, ordered his troops not to participate in the attack and testified publicly about the massacre. Soule was assassinated the next year. More on the Sand Creek Massacre: http://bit.ly/V4PCmU Here is a story about Silas Soule: http://bit.ly/11j1chy (Note that the Colonel in charge of the massacre has a town named after him in Colorado, Soule does not.) We recommend a related book of YA book historical fiction called Choke Creek: http://www.chokecreek.com/ Photo: Camp Weld Conference, 9/28/1864. Front row, kneeling on right: Silas S. Soule. Middle row, seated, 3rd from left: Black Kettle.

See More

entry.title: Thanks to artist Reed Bmore, Elijah McClain now sits above...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Thanks to artist Reed Bmore, Elijah McClain now sits above Denver playing violin to a kitten, a perfect tribute and reminder of the life APD took away.

Elijah still needs justice. We demand murder charges for Jason Rosenblatt, Nathan Woodward, and Randy Roedema. We demand restitution for the McClain family. There are so many who have stood in the way of justice who have escaped consequences, while those who have fought tirelessly for justice are facing the potential of decad...es in prison‚Äîthis should be reversed.

Ultimately, justice will only be served when we dismantle the system that took Elijah‚Äôs life, and so many others like him, and we build a new society free from the brutality of the police and the racist system they serve.

Artist is @reedbmoreart on Instagram

See More

entry.title: ‚ÄúWhile in one breath Mayor Michael Hancock greenlights the use...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

‚ÄúWhile in one breath Mayor Michael Hancock greenlights the use of tents on sidewalks for restaurants, with his next breath he instructs his police force to remove unhoused residents from tents alongside a vacant lot ‚Äî endangering the entire Denver community in the process.

‚ÄúAs the encampment at Arkins Court proves, homeless sweeps do not reduce the problem of homelessness; they exacerbate it. The solution to homelessness is not violent sweeps ‚Äî it is housing. Of housing, ther...e is no shortage in Denver ‚Äì 20,560 vacant units sit empty within the city limits. The real crime is that the city would rather force its residents out onto the street during a pandemic than jeopardize the profits of its wealthy landlord class. We need a socialist government that would oversee the production and distribution of housing for people, not for profits.‚Äù

https://www.liberationnews.org/as-winter-approaches-denver‚Ä¶/

See MoreLiberation News previously reported on Denver‚Äôs non-CDC-compliant homeless sweeps in May, and as winter approaches, the city is continuing to sweep residents. entry.title: Highly recommended ‚Äî an excellent discussion of the real story...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Highly recommended ‚Äî an excellent discussion of the real story of Thanksgiving

The Socialist Program with Brian Becker

Creation Myths Part 1: The Real Story of Thanksgiving

In the first installment of an ongoing series where The Socialist Program examines the real origins of U.S.... society, we discuss the true history of Thanksgiving. Brian and Dr. Gerald Horne talk about the history of settler colonialism in the United States, how it gave rise to slavery and white supremacist ideology, and the enduring features of U.S. society that can be traced to these phenomena.

Dr. Gerald Horne holds the Moores Professorship of History and African American Studies at the University of Houston and the author of many books, including ‚ÄúThe Dawning of the Apocalypse: The Roots of Slavery, White Supremacy, Settler Colonialism, and Capitalism in the Long Sixteenth Century.‚Äù He is also the author of ‚ÄúThe Bittersweet Science: Racism, Racketeering, and the Political Economy of Boxing.‚Äù

Listen: https://soundcloud.com/‚Ä¶/creation-myths-part-1-the-real-sto‚Ä¶

See More

entry.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+7RedfishDiego Maradona, anti-imperialist, socialist and arguably the greatest football player of...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+7Redfish

Diego Maradona, anti-imperialist, socialist and arguably the greatest football player of all time passed away at the age of 60.

Maradona was a leftist on the f...ootball fields and also in politics. As a football player he tirelessly fought against corruption in the International Federation of Association Football (FIFA), which he compared to a mafia. He struggled to unionize football players and in the late 90s, Maradona, with other prominent stars, formed the International Association of Professional Football Players to defend players' rights.

Maradona, also known as "El 10", openly showed his support to left-wing, socialist and progressive movements and governments in the world and specifically in Latin America. He also openly defied imperialism and colonialism and was a firm supporter of the Palestinian cause saying "in my heart I am Palestinian." and "I am a defender of the Palestinian people, I respect them and sympathize with them, I support Palestine without fear".

He proudly wore a Che Guevara tattoo on his arm and a Fidel Castro one on his leg. He was a close friend and supporter of Hugo Chavez, Evo Morales and Fidel Castro among other socialist leaders. He once said "I believe in Hugo Ch√°vez. I am Chavista. Everything that he and Fidel do, from my point of view, is the best". As a socialist and anti-imperialist Maradona remained a committed supporter of Venezuela's Bolivarian Revolution and progressive social movements across Latin America, never losing hope in the poor and the oppressed to emancipate themselves.

"I am from the left in the sense that I am (...) for the progress of my country, to improve the life of poor people, so that we all have peace and freedom." [...] "We cannot be bought, we are lefties on the feet, we are lefties on the hands, and we are lefties on the mind. That has to be known by the people, that we say the truth, that we want equality, and that we don't want the Yankee flag planted on us."

Rest in power, Diego Armando Maradona!

(Photos via Reuters and Getty)

See More

entry.title: Four years ago, Fidel Castro Ruiz died peacefully of natural...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Four years ago, Fidel Castro Ruiz died peacefully of natural causes at the age of 90, after having survived over 600 assassination attempts by the U.S. government during his time as a leader of the Cuban Revolution.

Fidel‚Äôs life was testament to his astonishing will to struggle, surviving hundreds of CIA assassination attempts, because of U.S. imperialism‚Äôs fear of Cuba‚Äôs example. Fidel fought without let-up for his people, for revolution, for socialism.

Fidel was the ultimat...e revolutionary. He was fully aware of his essential historic leadership in the Revolution, but just as important was his guidance in building the Communist Party of Cuba and continually inspiring a people who would fight no matter the adversities.

The revolution against the U.S. puppet Batista, which ushered in the Cuban Revolution, was carried out during what would seem an inauspicious time.

The 1950s were a time of anti-communist hysteria led by the United States which thoroughly dominated Cuba at the time and whose aim was to crush the communist movement and workers‚Äô struggles at home and abroad. Yet, Fidel believed that after Batista‚Äôs military coup in 1952, that it was the very time to strike.

The next year, Fidel led the July 26 assault on the Moncada barracks in eastern Cuba. While the revolutionary combatants were defeated and many killed, the Moncada attack would give birth to the July 26th Movement. In 1956, Fidel and his comrades, including Che Guevara and Raul Castro, launched the guerrilla war that brought down the Batista regime on January 1, 1959.

The 1950s and 60s was also a time of emerging national liberation struggles in Africa, Latin America and Asia

Fidel‚Äôs steel determination and victory over U.S. imperialism helped revive the ideas of revolutionary socialism in Latin America and across the globe. Many national liberation struggles in Latin America, Africa and Asia gained strength from the assistance of revolutionary Cuba.

Fidel‚Äôs legacy will endure because he leaves a strong country of true revolutionaries, people who have given of themselves countless times as medical workers, as teachers, as construction workers, as military combatants, all for the liberation of humanity.

See MoreSee the results and other info about the 2020 US Election. See Election Results

entry.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
